diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: bile duct obstruction, R. IJ thrombosis/DVT, hand cellulitis, minor anemia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with elevated liver function tests and intermittent right upper quadrant pain. MRCP showed mildly dilated intrahepatic ducts, concerning for primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC), leading to ERCP attempts. The patient's symptoms and imaging findings supported the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis along with additional complications.
